node.title: Police may be one step closer to solving missing persons cases thanks to a new forensic DNA lab
node.alt: A woman wearing blue personal protective equipment looks at a grey slide in a laboratory
node.description: Families of long-term missing persons may be one step closer to findingÂ answers about their loved ones, with a new forensic testing facility in Canberra set to re-examine remains.
node.content:
["There are 2,600 long-term missing persons in Australia, but, today, their families\u00a0may be one step closer to receiving closure.", "The Australian Federal Police (AFP) have\u00a0begun\u00a0testing hundreds of unidentified human remains in a new dedicated forensics laboratory based in Canberra.", "While dental records and DNA profiles have long been tools used by police agencies, now, forensic specialists will also be able to estimate an individual's year of birth and death, ancestral origin, hair and eye colour and even their facial appearance.", "AFP Acting Deputy Commissioner of Operations Justine Gough\u00a0said the demand for forensic testing was much higher than\u00a0initially thought.", "\"At the start of the program, it was estimated that there would be around about 500 sets of human remains in police, forensic and mortuary facilities around Australia. Our national audit has revealed that that number is 850 sets of human remains,\" she said.", "", "
Associate Professor Jodie Ward says the technology will be used to try and identify 850 remains from across Australia.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "She\u00a0said she hoped the new program would provide answers to families of missing persons.", "\"Not knowing where their loved ones are, not even knowing whether their loved ones are alive or not. This program will be able to provide answers to resolve some of those cases.\"", "Lead scientist\u00a0Jodie Ward said the program \"depended\" on the participation of family members.", "\"We do have a lot of family interest in the program, but ...\u00a0we are appealing to families with long-term missing persons because the success of our program is dependent on their participation,\" Associate Professor Ward said.\u00a0", "She said some of the remains that would go through the new forensic testing process might have previously been tested, but with the improvement in technology, there were higher chances of identifying the remains now.\u00a0", "\"So we\u00a0are now in a position to apply these modern forensic techniques to these challenging remains in the hope of getting results that we would never have been able to get previously.\"", "", "
Some remains may have been tested before, but will be retested with the new technology.(Supplied)
", "It is hoped the new program will bring police one step closer to resolving some of Australia's most complex missing persons cases, with recent wins for the team including identifying the unknown sailor from HMAS Sydney.\u00a0", "\"The lab was operational a couple of months ago, and we've been successful in assisting the Australian Defence Force in identifying the unknown sailor,\"\u00a0Associate Professor Ward said.", "With major breakthroughs in recent weeks, scientists are hopeful the dedicated facility\u00a0will provide answers for even more families.\u00a0"]
